name: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information
sec_head: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee records his/her acknowledgement that he/she is aware of the income earning opportunities available to the Employee by virtue of this agreement and arising out of knowledge that the Employee will gain of the business practices, client contacts and knowledge of properties and training opportunities.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee therefore agrees that during the terms of this agreement and thereafter:
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee shall not directly or indirectly disclose or divulge to any person, save insofar as may be absolutely necessary in the normal and ordinary course of providing his/her services to the Employer:
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Any of the business or financial affairs, dealings, secrets, inventions, formulae, methods, designs or other information of the Employer’s or the clients of the Employer’s business, franchisor or group whatsoever; and/or
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Any written instructions, drawings, notes, memoranda or records relating to the Employer’s or the client of the Employer’s business and affairs which are prepared by the Employee or which come into the possession or knowledge of the Employee during the course of his/her employment. Any such written instructions, drawings, notes, memoranda or records shall be deemed to be the property of the Employer and shall be surrendered to the Employer on demand and/or upon the termination of this agreement for any reasons whatsoever. The Employee will not retain copies and/or extracts thereof.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Persuade, induce, solicit, encourage or procure any employee employed by the Employer to:
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Become employed by, or interested in any manner whatsoever, in any business, directly or indirectly in competition with the business carried on by the Employer and/or the client of the Employer; and/or
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Terminate his/her employment with Employer.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee hereby acknowledges that any records, documents or data, however stored, or intellectual property rights which may arise out of the provision of his/her services in terms of this agreement shall belong to the Employer and upon termination of this agreement all such records, documents and/or data must be immediately returned to the Employer.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee hereby acknowledges that the Employee shall not use any of the information referred to in paragraphs {par."Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information"}.1 – {par."Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information"}.3 above for any purpose other than the provision of services to the Employer.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employer shall reserve the right to retain any and all rights to any patents, trademarks and/or copyrights to any information, inventions, designs, discoveries and/or improvements made, discovered or conceived by the Employee during his/her employment with the Employer, whether wholly or partly and whether in connection with- or incidental to his/her employment with the Employer or its’ clients and which may relate to-, be in connection with and/or be useful to the business carried out by the Employer, whether or not during normal working hours and whether or not at the Employer’s premises. Such patents, trademarks and/or copyrights shall not be limited to any particular are or country and the Employer shall have the right to alter, modify, adapt and/or change any designs, processes or methods of any such patents, trademarks and/or copyrights.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee shall not copy, print or publish any of the Employer’s information, methods, processes or procedures relating to the business of the Employer unless permission has been granted by the Employer to do so.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee be in breach of these paragraphs on termination of this agreement or at any time thereafter, the Employer, without prejudice to any other rights it may have, will be entitled to withhold all payments still due and outstanding at that stage to the Employee.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee be in breach of this clause on termination of this agreement and thereafter, it is agreed between the Parties that damages to the Company will be calculated as follows:
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee conduct any business with any client of the Company whatsoever outside of his/her ordinary duties while Employed, the damages to the Company will be calculated as the total Gross Income ordinarily received from that client of the Company over a three (3) month period; and/or
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee entice- and/or attempt to entice any other Employee of the Company to leave the employment of the Employer, damages owing to the Employer will be calculated as all training costs incurred by the Employer for all training provided to that Employee as well as 18% of that Employee’s Gross Annual Remuneration.
sec_par.parent: Confidentiality of Company and/or Client Information

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee shall be expected to satisfactorily carry out all the tasks and duties normally associated with the position for which he/she has been appointed.

The Employee undertakes to obey any and all reasonable and lawful orders and instructions given by the Employer or any person employed by the Employer or the client of the Employer who is authorised to give such instructions.

The Employee confirms that he/she is capable and competent to perform the duties for which he/she has been appointed and that he/she has the necessary skills and knowledge to perform competently and to the satisfaction of the Employer.

This contract shall be the entire agreement between the Parties and no variation, alteration and/or addition will be of any force or effect unless placed in writing, signed by both Parties and attached hereto.
Both Parties acknowledge that by signing this contract, they have received a copy of this contract and have read and understood the contents hereof.
Both Parties undertake to hold themselves bound by this contract and agree to observe the provision contained herein.
If applicable, the Employee confirms that the contents of this agreement have been interpreted and/or explained to him/her by the interpreter as noted below.
The Employee furthermore agrees that should the Employee be unable to perform his/her duties, that the operational needs of the employer may require the termination of this agreement.
The Employee agrees that should he/she fail to report for **three (3)** or more consecutive days without notifying the Employer he/she shall be deemed to have deserted.

The Employee expressly agrees that where the exemptions contained in Section 6 of the BCEA apply to him/her, that the provisions of Sections 8 to 18 of that Act do not apply to the employment relationship.
The Employer and the Employee will in their conduct and relationship comply with the laws of the Republic of South Africa.
The Employee explicitly agrees that he/she is employed by the Employer and not any client of the Employer where he/she may be required to work while fulfilling the terms of this contract.

The Employee agrees not to participate in- or to incite any other person to participate in any illegal/unprotected industrial action which may adversely affect any of the Employer’s- or any clients of the Employer’s operations. Such action may include but is not limited to strikes, pickets, go-slows, work-to-rule, boycotts, stay-aways or any other similar action which may obstruct, prevent or retard the work of other employees or the operations of the Employer or any client of the Employer.
Should an Employee participate in any form of unprotected/illegal industrial action, such participation will be viewed as a blatant repudiation of the employment agreement.
The Employee agrees to participate only in legal industrial action which may have arisen after the statutory or agreed dispute setting procedure has been followed.
The Employee agrees to assist the Employer in endeavouring to promote, enhance and maintain industrial peace and harmony in the workplace.
The “no-work-no-pay” principle will apply in all cases of industrial action.
Annual Leave
Annual leave will accrue at a rate of one (1) day for every seventeen (17) days worked.
All occasional leave granted during the leave cycle will be deducted from the Employee’s accrued annual leave.
The Employer has an annual shutdown over the period of December and the Employee must take a portion of his/her annual leave during that period.

Should an Employee’s accrued annual leave not be sufficient to cover the period of the abovementioned annual shutdown, the employee will be placed on annual leave for the period not covered by his/her accrued annual leave.
The Employee must take his/her annual leave within six (6) months of the conclusion of his/her leave cycle and any annual leave not taken at the end of this period will be forfeited.
Sick Leave
Sick leave will accrue at a rate of one (1) day for every twenty-six (26) days worked.
During the first six (6) months of employment, sick leave will be calculated according to Section 22(3) of the BCEA.
For the remainder of the period of employment, the provisions of Section 22(2) of the abovementioned Act shall apply.
Sick leave will only be granted upon provision of proof of incapacity in the form of a medical certificate.
Family Responsibility Leave

The Employee will, after four (4) months of continuous employment with the Employer qualify for a maximum of three (3) non-accumulative paid days of family responsibility leave during any twelve (12) month leave cycle.
Family responsibility leave will only apply:
when the Employee’s child is sick; or
in the event of the death of:
the Employee’s spouse or life partner; or
the Employee’s parent, adoptive parent, grandparent, child, adopted child, grandchild or sibling.
Maternity Leave
Female Employees will be entitled to a minimum of four (4) months of unpaid maternity leave at each instance of pregnancy of that Employee.
The Employee must inform the Employer as soon as is possible after finding out of her pregnancy.

Should the Employer not be able to accommodate a pregnant Employee for any reason whatsoever related to the operational requirements and/or business practices of the Employer, such Employee may be instructed to commence with her maternity leave once she can no longer be accommodated by the Employer and return only once a medical practitioner has certified that she may do so.
An Employee must commence her maternity leave no later than four (4) weeks prior to the expected date of birth of the child.
An Employee must commence her maternity leave at any time when a medical practitioner or midwife certifies that it is necessary for her to commence her maternity leave.
An Employee may only resume work six (6) weeks after the birth of her child or once a medical practitioner has certified that is safe for her to do so.

In the event of a miscarriage or stillbirth in the third trimester of pregnancy, a female Employee may commence her maternity leave for a period of no more than six (6) weeks subject to the provisions hereof read with the necessary changes in context.
Parental Leave
Parental Leave is governed by Sections 25A-C of the BCEA and the provisions contained therein are herewith summarized as follows:

Employees who do not qualify for Maternity Leave may qualify for Parental leave if he/she is a parent but not the pregnant mother of an expected child for a total period of ten (10) days of unpaid parental leave.

The Employee must inform the Employer as soon as possible after finding out the expected due date of the child, either though birth from his/her partner or from delivery by the Surrogate Mother or, in the instance of an adoption, the date on which the final adoption order is granted or the child is placed with the adoptive parent(s) and may commence his/her Parental leave on the expected due date or the date of birth and/or receipt of his/her child.

Where an Employee and his/her partner are expecting a child through Adoption of through the Commissioning of a Surrogate Birth, only one of the partners may qualify for Parental Leave while the other partner may qualify for Adoption- or Commissioning Leave, while the choice remains that of the expectant parents, it is explicitly noted that only one parent may take either Adoption- or Commissioning Leave, whereas the other parent is only entitled to Parental Leave.

Where an Employee qualifies for Adoption- or Commissioning Leave, the same principles apply as for Parental Leave, excepting that an Employee now qualifies for a period of ten (10) weeks of unpaid Adoption- or Commissioning Leave.
Unless otherwise agreed in writing and appended hereto, the Employee will not be entitled to any other benefits during the period of employment.
The Employee is being employed in the position of {designation}.
Notwithstanding {par."Position"}.1 above, the employee will perform any other duties that may be required from him/her from time to time.

sec_par.clause_text: Employee Disciplinary Record;

sec_par.clause_text: Employee Gender; and/or

sec_par.clause_text: Employee Remuneration.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Permission given in paragraph {par."Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)"}.1.1 does not include the use of the personal information of the data subject for marketing purposes to third parties and the Employer undertakes not to share such personal information for the purpose of marketing.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employer undertakes to comply with relevant legislation insofar as the collection, processing and retention of personal information is concerned, including implementing such necessary safeguards as are reasonably necessary to ensure the confidentiality of the personal information of the Employee.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee is aware of the fact that he/she may, in terms of the Company Policy, request that his/her personal information may be updated as well as that parties with access to the Employee’s personal information be disclosed to the Employee.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee agrees that the Employer may release such personal information to third parties as is required to ensure compliance with its legal, statutory and organizational obligations and requirements with the provision that such data processors comply with the relevant legislation.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee agrees that the processing of his/her personal information in compliance with this agreement is agreed to by him/her and that he/she is aware that such processing by external parties, including service providers, employers’ organisations, trade unions, creditors and/or future employers forms part of this agreement.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: Undertaking to keep confidential any personal information which the Employee may have access to by virtue of being an operator:
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee records his/her acknowledgement that he/she is aware of the income earning opportunities available to the Employee by virtue of this agreement and arising out of knowledge that the Employee will gain of the business practices, client contacts and knowledge of properties, personal information of persons and/or entities and training opportunities.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: Any of the business or financial affairs, dealings, secrets, inventions, formulae, methods, designs, personal or other information of the Employer’s or the clients of the Employer’s business franchisor or group whatsoever nor any member of the public or any other person or entity with whom the Employee may have contact during the exercise of his/her duties; and/or
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: Any written instructions, drawings, notes, memoranda, personal information or records relating to the Employer’s or the client of the Employer’s business and affairs which are prepared by the Employee or which come into the possession or knowledge of the Employee during the course of his/her employment. Any such written instructions, drawings, notes, memoranda, personal information or records shall be deemed to be the property of the Employer and shall be surrendered to the Employer on demand and/or upon the termination of this agreement for any reasons whatsoever. The Employee will not retain copies and/or extracts thereof.

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee hereby acknowledges that the Employee shall not use any of the information referred to in paragraphs {par."Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)"}.2.2.1 above for any purpose other than the provision of services to the Employer and/or the clients of the Employer.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee shall not copy, print or publish any of the Employer’s, the Client of the Employer’s or any other person or entity’s information, methods, personal information, processes or procedures relating to the business of the Employer unless express written permission has been granted by the Employer to do so.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee be in breach of these paragraphs on termination of this agreement or at any time thereafter, the Employer, without prejudice to any other rights it may have, will be entitled to withhold all payments still due and outstanding at that stage to the Employee.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: Should the Employee be in breach of this clause on termination of this agreement and thereafter, it is agreed between the Parties that damages to the Company, it’s client or any other person or entity shall be payable solely by the Employee and that the Employee herewith explicitly agrees that he/she shall be solely liable for any damages in this regard.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee herewith confirms that he/she is a competent person and is legally entitled to enter into this agreement as envisioned in the POPIA.
sec_par.parent: Protection of Personal Information in terms of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 2013 (POPIA)

sec_par.clause_text: The Employee, through his/her signature on this contract agrees to be bound by- and obey all the rules, regulations, policies and/or procedures which have been- and/or may be drawn up by the Employer or any client of the Employer.

The Employer will endeavour to ensure that the Employee is made familiar with any such rules, regulations, policies and/or procedures which are applicable to the Employee, however it remains the responsibility of the Employee to ensure that he/she is familiar with such rules, regulations, policies and/or procedures which may apply to him/her.

The Employer and/or any client of the Employer reserves the right to change, amend, add or delete any such rules, regulations, policies and/or procedures as may become necessary during the course of the employment relationship without consulting with the Employee.

The Employer’s disciplinary code forms part of this agreement and by signing this agreement the Employee confirms that he/she is aware of the contents of the disciplinary code as well as that he/she agrees to be bound by provisions of the disciplinary code.

The Employee shall not be entitled to do any work, during or outside his/her normal working hours for any other employer or conduct his/her own business unless the nature and his/her involvement has been disclosed to the Employer and the Employer has provided his/her written consent.

It is explicitly recorded that the Employee acknowledges and agrees that, in the event that he/she is found in any area that is designated as a no-go area by the Company and/or Client of the Company, that he/she shall face dismissal as well as any claims for damages which result from the Employee’s actions.

The Employee agrees to observe and obey all the health, safety and security rules and regulations as prescribed by the Employer and/or any client of the Employer as well as any applicable legislation. These rules include the acknowledgement that the Employee agrees and understands that he/she may not enter any designated no-go areas and/or areas outside of where he/she is required to perform his/her duties.

The Employee agrees that the Employer or persons appointed by the Employer, or any client of the Employer may, from time-to-time conduct searches of the Employee’s person or personal possessions for security or safety reasons. Such searches may include any vehicle of the Employee which may enter and/or leave the premises of the Employer or the client of the Employer.
The Employee shall wear any security identification device(s) which the Employer and/or the client of the Employer may issue, at all required times.

It is a fundamental requirement of this contract that all persons employed by the Employer must be found to show zero deception in applicable tests, including but not limited to polygraph examinations, as and when such tests are requested by the Employer or the client of the Employer. This requirement goes to the root of the employment contract and the principles of //uberrimea fidei// (the utmost trust).

This undertaking is a material term of this contract. Refusal to undergo investigation is accordingly a serious offence amounting to the repudiation of the fundamental terms of this agreement by the Employee and may lead to termination of this agreement.

Failure on the part of the Employee to show zero deception in such tests will lead to disciplinary action being taken against the Employee, which may lead to the summary termination of this employment contract, subject clause {par.Termination of Employment"} hereof.

Furthermore, the Employee acknowledges that the findings of a polygraph examination may be considered as proof of guilt in any investigation into alleged misconduct and agrees to be bound to the finding of such testing.

Herewith, I acknowledge that I have read, understood, and agreed to the specific clauses as relates to the use of polygraph testing as well as no-go areas.

I, {employee_name}, hereby give my unequivocal consent and/or co-operation to undergo investigation from time to time. Such investigation may include verification of answers given by myself with the use of electronic equipment such as polygraph and computer voice stress analysis tests. I further agree and acknowledge that the Employer may terminate my employment if I am found in any area where I am not authorized to be at any time, as well as recover from me damages for any losses suffered by the Employer in such an event.
